intro: Lobelia patzquarensis, commonly known as the Patzcuarensis Lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests, where it thrives in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often trailing or upright depending on the habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
